intro: Phyllanthus merripaensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Phyllanthus merripaensis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
